Container.Name: jellyfin
Container.Overview: Jellyfin is a Free Software Media System that puts you in control of managing and streaming your media. It is an alternative to the proprietary Emby and Plex, to provide media from a dedicated server to end-user devices via multiple apps.[br][br] [span style='color: #E80000;']Host Mappings Explanation[/span][br] [b]Port 8097[/b] : This is to not conflict with Emby. It is pointed to 8096 in the container (No effect in host mode - reference only).[br] [b]Port 8921[/b] : This is to not conflict with Emby. It is pointed to 8920 in the container (No effect in host mode - reference only).[br] [b]/mnt/user/data/Media[/b] : This is where the Media folder exists for Movies, TV Shows, Music, etc. You would then have your libraries pointed here, like /mnt/user/data/media/Movies[br] [b]/mnt/user/appdata/jellyfin[/b] : This is where Jellyfin stores all of the files for the library and plugins. This points to /config in the docker container.[br] [b]/mnt/user/appdata/transcode[/b] : This is where Jellyfin will transcode to. This points to /transcode in the docker container.[br][br] [span style='color: #E80000;']Intel GPU Use[/span][br]Edit your [b]go[/b] file to include:[br][b]modprobe i915[br][/b], save and reboot.[br] Alternately on the newest Unraid (6.9.0-beta35 or higher) you can run the following two commands:[br] [b]mkdir /boot/config/modprobe.d[/b][br] [b]touch /boot/config/modprobe.d/i915.conf[/b][br][br] [span style='color: #E80000;']NVIDIA GPU Use[/span][/u][/b][br] Using the Unraid Nvidia Plugin (or the NVIDIA-Driver plugin on Unraid 6.9.0-beta35 or higher) to install a version of Unraid with the Nvidia Drivers installed and add [b]--runtime=nvidia[/b] to [b]"extra parameters"[/b] (switch on advanced view) and copy your [b]GPU UUID[/b] to [b]NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES[/b] (or just us leave it set to 'all').
